Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2011 10:47PM Flopsie2 wrote: Feb 8th is my bilateral mastectomy with sentinel node, too.  I'm right handed and that worries me with any kind of lymphedema - the surgeon said he was removing nodes that would be under my right arm.  When the pathology comes back then I'll know what's next on the agenda.  Are you having reconstruction?  I'm having expanders - long process, but that was my only choice without the nodes being diagnosed.  My logical self knows this is the right thing to do, but I'm not sure how I'm going to get through this mess emotionally - how about you?  Anyone who has insight on the emotional end of this stick, please help out.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2011 12:17PM Flopsie2 wrote: Good news for me today - the sentinel nodes removed during my bilateral mastectomy are clean - no cancer in the nodes  Valentine's Day just became one of my favorite holidays!  I still need to see my oncologist for whatever preventative treatments might be needed, but I can now look forward to happier days.  A very happy Valentine's Day to you all!!!!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT
